subject: Home & DIY
title: The Egg Chair's Organic Shell
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Egg Chair's Organic Shell usable.

hook.text: Arne Jacobsen sculpted the Egg Chair from a single foam shell in 1958. He hand-shaped the prototype in his own garage.

buildup.text: Designed for Copenhagen's SAS Royal Hotel, the chair needed to create privacy in a vast open lobby.

discovery.text: The enveloping high-back shape blocks peripheral vision and sound, creating a personal cocoon in public space.

twist.text: Every Egg Chair is still hand-upholstered at Fritz Hansen in Denmark. One chair takes a craftsperson a full day.

climax.text: At over $10,000 new, it appears in movies and TV as instant shorthand for sophisticated taste.

quiz.question: What problem was the Egg Chair designed to solve?
options: Creating privacy in a large open hotel lobby
